page.title: 01East Smarden and Area
page.content: The area covers Smarden east of the church, a part of Bethersden around Tuesnoad & Wissenden and a few acres of Pluckley near the brickworks. Smarden, a typical picturesque Wealden village with 13th century church, white weatherboarded & half timbered houses, is visited and photographed by many English & overseas tourists. The Chequers & Flying Horse pubs, selling Kentish ale, are very popular. There are 271 properties of which 64 are known to be rented. 143 properties are detached. During the year at least 16 properties have been for sale at prices from Â£50,000. A population count in August revealed 157 persons under 18 and 575 adults of whom 159 were senior citizens, 26 of the latter being residents of the old people's home. There have been 4 deaths and no births in the year.
